text: Adam, Seth, Enosh;
speaker: Narrator

text: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared;
speaker: Narrator

text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech;
speaker: Narrator

text: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Diphath, and Togarmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Ham: Cush and Egypt, Put, and Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, and Sabteca. The descendants of Raama: Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cush became the father of Nimrod; he was the first to be a mighty one on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Egypt became the father of Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Pathrusim, Casluhim, and Caphtorim, from whom the Philistines come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Canaan became the father of Sidon his firstborn, and Heth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram. The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arpachshad became the father of Shelah, and Shelah became the father of Eber.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg (for in his days the earth was divided), and the name of his brother was Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab; all these were the descendants of Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah;
speaker: Narrator

text: Eber, Peleg, Reu;
speaker: Narrator

text: Serug, Nahor, Terah;
speaker: Narrator

text: Abram, that is, Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are their genealogies: the firstborn of Ishmael was Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: she bore Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the descendants of Keturah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham became the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam; and Lotan’s sister was Timna.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shobal: Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan. The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the Israelites: Bela son of Beor, whose city was called Dinhabah.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah of Bozrah succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, succeeded him, and the name of his city was Avith.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Samlah died, Shaul of Rehoboth on the River succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Shaul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Baal-hanan died, Hadad succeeded him; the name of his city was Pai, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred daughter of Me-zahab.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And Hadad died.
The clans of Edom were: clans Timna, Aliah, Jetheth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
speaker: Narrator

text: Magdiel, and Iram; these are the clans of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, and Shelah; these three the Canaanite woman Bath-shua bore to him. Now Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the Lord, and he put him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: His daughter-in-law Tamar also bore him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Darda, five in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Carmi: Achar, the troubler of Israel, who transgressed in the matter of the devoted thing;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ethan’s son was Azariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hezron who were born to him: Jerahmeel, Ram, and Chelubai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ram became the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, prince of the sons of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nahshon became the father of Salma, Salma of Boaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: Boaz of Obed, Obed of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesse became the father of Eliab his firstborn, Abinadab the second, Shimea the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ozem the sixth, David the seventh;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The sons of Zeruiah: Abishai, Joab, and Asahel, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abigail bore Amasa, and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Caleb son of Hezron had children by his wife Azubah and by Jerioth; these were her sons: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hur became the father of Uri, and Uri became the father of Bezalel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir father of Gilead, whom he married when he was sixty years old, and she bore him Segub,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Segub became the father of Jair, who had twenty-three towns in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Geshur and Aram took from them Havvoth-jair, Kenath and its villages, sixty towns. All these were descendants of Machir, father of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the death of Hezron in Caleb-ephrathah, Abijah wife of Hezron bore him Ashhur, father of Tekoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jerahmeel, the firstborn of Hezron: Ram his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerahmeel also had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ram, the firstborn of Jerahmeel: Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Onam: Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of Abishur’s wife was Abihail, and she bore him Ahban and Molid.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim; and Seled died childless.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Appaim: Ishi. The son of Ishi: Sheshan. The son of Sheshan: Ahlai.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jada, Shammai’s brother: Jether and Jonathan; and Jether died childless.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Sheshan had no sons, only daughters, but Sheshan had an Egyptian slave whose name was Jarha.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to his slave Jarha, and she bore him Attai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Attai became the father of Nathan, and Nathan of Zabad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zabad became the father of Ephlal, and Ephlal of Obed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Obed became the father of Jehu, and Jehu of Azariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah became the father of Helez, and Helez of Eleasah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleasah became the father of Sismai, and Sismai of Shallum.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum became the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah of Elishama.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Caleb brother of Jerahmeel: Mesha his firstborn, who was father of Ziph. The sons of Mareshah father of Hebron.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hebron: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shema became father of Raham, father of Jorkeam; and Rekem became the father of Shammai.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Shammai: Maon; and Maon was the father of Beth-zur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ephah also, Caleb’s concubine, bore Haran, Moza, and Gazez; and Haran became the father of Gazez.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jahdai: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Maacah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.
speaker: Narrator

text: She also bore Shaaph father of Madmannah, Sheva father of Machbenah and father of Gibea; and the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These were the descendants of Caleb.
The sons of Hur the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal father of Kiriath-jearim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Salma father of Bethlehem, and Hareph father of Beth-gader.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shobal father of Kiriath-jearim had other sons: Haroeh, half of the Menuhoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the families of Kiriath-jearim: the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; from these came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Salma: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The families also of the scribes that lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and the Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, father of the house of Rechab.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron: the firstborn Amnon, by Ahinoam the Jezreelite; the second Daniel, by Abigail the Carmelite;
speaker: Narrator

text: the third Absalom, son of Maacah daughter of King Talmai of Geshur; the fourth Adonijah, son of Haggith;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifth Shephatiah, by Abital; the sixth Ithream, by his wife Eglah;
speaker: Narrator

text: six were born to him in Hebron, where he reigned for seven years and six months. And he reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were born to him in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon, four by Bath-shua daughter of Ammiel;
speaker: Narrator

text: then Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were David’s sons, besides the sons of the concubines, and Tamar was their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Solomon: Rehoboam, Abijah his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Amon his son, Josiah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Josiah: Johanan the firstborn, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Jehoiakim: Jeconiah his son, Zedekiah his son;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the sons of Jeconiah the captive: Shealtiel his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel and Shimei; and the sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam and Hananiah, and Shelomith was their sister;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-hesed, five.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hananiah: Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, his son Rephaiah, his son Arnan, his son Obadiah, his son Shecaniah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Shecaniah: Shemaiah, and the sons of Shemaiah: Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat—six.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Neariah: Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani, seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reaiah son of Shobal became the father of Jahath, and Jahath became the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the families of the Zorathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash; and the name of their sister was Hazzelelponi,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer was the father of Hushah. These were the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, the father of Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashhur father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah;
speaker: Narrator

text: Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Helah: Zereth, Izhar, and Ethnan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Koz became the father of Anub, Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel son of Harum.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jabez was honored more than his brothers, and his mother named him Jabez, saying, “Because I bore him in pain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, “Oh, that you would bless me and enlarge my territory and that your hand might be with me and that you would keep me from hurt and harm!” And God granted what he asked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chelub the brother of Shuhah became the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eshton became the father of Beth-rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir-nahash. These are the men of Recah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah; and the sons of Othniel: Hathath and Meonothai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meonothai became the father of Ophrah, and Seraiah became the father of Joab father of Ge-harashim, so-called because they were artisans.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, and Naam; and the son of Elah: Kenaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ezrah: Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. These are the sons of Bithiah, daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered married, and she conceived and bore Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah father of Eshtemoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his Judean wife bore Jered father of Gedor, Heber father of Soco, and Jekuthiel father of Zanoah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of the wife of Hodiah, the sister of Naham, were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shimon: Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-hanan, and Tilon. The sons of Ishi: Zoheth and Ben-zoheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shelah son of Judah: Er father of Lecah, Laadah father of Mareshah, and the families of the guild of linen workers at Beth-ashbea;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jokim, and the men of Cozeba, and Joash, and Saraph, who married into Moab but returned to Lehem (the records are ancient).
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the potters and inhabitants of Netaim and Gederah; they lived there with the king in his service.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul;
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum was his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Mishma: Hammuel his son, Zaccur his son, Shimei his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers did not have many children, nor did all their family multiply like the Judeans.
speaker: Narrator

text: They lived in Beer-sheba, Moladah, Hazar-shual,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth-marcaboth, Hazar-susim, Beth-biri, and Shaaraim. These were their towns until David became king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan, five towns,
speaker: Narrator

text: along with all their villages that were around these towns as far as Baal. These were their settlements. And they kept a genealogical record.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah son of Seraiah son of Asiel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ziza son of Shiphi son of Allon son of Jedaiah son of Shimri son of Shemaiah—
speaker: Narrator

text: these mentioned by name were leaders in their families, and their clans increased greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed to the entrance of Gedor, to the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks,
speaker: Narrator

text: where they found rich, good pasture, and the land was very broad, quiet, and peaceful, for the former inhabitants there belonged to Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: These, registered by name, came in the days of King Hezekiah of Judah and attacked their tents and the Meunim who were found there and exterminated them to this day and settled in their place, because there was pasture there for their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of them, five hundred men of the Simeonites, went to Mount Seir, having as their leaders Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, sons of Ishi;
speaker: Narrator

text: they destroyed the remnant of the Amalekites who had escaped, and they have lived there to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel. (He was the firstborn, but because he defiled his father’s bed his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel, so that he is not enrolled in the genealogy according to the birthright;
speaker: Narrator

text: though Judah became prominent among his brothers and a ruler came from him, yet the birthright belonged to Joseph.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beerah his son, whom King Tiglath-pileser of Assyria carried away into exile; he was a chieftain of the Reubenites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his kindred by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was reckoned: the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Bela son of Azaz, son of Shema, son of Joel, who lived in Aroer, as far as Nebo and Baal-meon.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also lived to the east as far as the beginning of the desert this side of the Euphrates, because their cattle had multiplied in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the days of Saul they made war on the Hagrites, who fell by their hand, and they lived in their tents throughout all the region east of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gad lived beside them in the land of Bashan as far as Salecah:
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel the chief, Shapham the second, Janai, and Shaphat in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their kindred according to their clans: Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber, seven.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Abihail son of Huri, son of Jaroah, son of Gilead, son of Michael, son of Jeshishai, son of Jahdo, son of Buz;
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahi son of Abdiel, son of Guni, was chief in their clan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they lived in Gilead, in Bashan and in its towns, and in all the pasturelands of Sharon to their limits.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of these were enrolled by genealogies in the days of King Jotham of Judah and in the days of King Jeroboam of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh had valiant warriors who carried shield and sword and drew the bow, expert in war, forty-four thousand seven hundred sixty, ready for service.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made war on the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab,
speaker: Narrator

text: and when they received help against them, the Hagrites and all who were with them were given into their hands, for they cried to God in the battle, and he granted their entreaty because they trusted in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They captured their livestock: fifty thousand of their camels, two hundred fifty thousand sheep, two thousand donkeys, and one hundred thousand captives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many fell slain because the war was of God. And they lived in their territory until the exile.
speaker: Narrator

text: The members of the half-tribe of Manasseh lived in the land; they were very numerous from Bashan to Baal-hermon, Senir, and Mount Hermon.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the heads of their clans: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, mighty warriors, famous men, heads of their clans.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they transgressed against the God of their ancestors and prostituted themselves to the gods of the peoples of the land whom God had destroyed before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of King Pul of Assyria, the spirit of King Tiglath-pileser of Assyria, and he carried them away, namely, the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, and brought them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and the River Gozan, to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Amram: Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar became the father of Phinehas, Phinehas of Abishua,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishua of Bukki, Bukki of Uzzi,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzzi of Zerahiah, Zerahiah of Meraioth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Meraioth of Amariah, Amariah of Ahitub,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahitub of Zadok, Zadok of Ahimaaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahimaaz of Azariah, Azariah of Johanan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Johanan of Azariah (it was he who served as priest in the house that Solomon built in Jerusalem).
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah became the father of Amariah, Amariah of Ahitub,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahitub of Zadok, Zadok of Shallum,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum of Hilkiah, Hilkiah of Azariah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah of Seraiah, Seraiah of Jehozadak;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jehozadak went into exile when the Lord sent Judah and Jerusalem into exile by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the clans of the Levites according to their ancestry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Gershom: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, Jeatherai his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath: Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elkanah: Amasai and Ahimoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah his son, Zophai his son, Nahath his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son, Samuel his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Samuel: Joel his firstborn, the second Abijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari: Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, and Asaiah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the men whom David put in charge of the service of song in the house of the Lord, after the ark came to rest there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They ministered with song before the tabernacle of the tent of meeting until Solomon had built the house of the Lord in Jerusalem, and they performed their service in due order.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the men who served, and their sons were: Of the Kohathites: Heman, the singer, son of Joel, son of Samuel,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Elkanah, son of Jeroham, son of Eliel, son of Toah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Zuph, son of Elkanah, son of Mahath, son of Amasai,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Elkanah, son of Joel, son of Azariah, son of Zephaniah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Tahath, son of Assir, son of Ebiasaph, son of Korah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Izhar, son of Kohath, son of Levi, son of Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text: and his kinsman Asaph, who stood on his right, namely, Asaph son of Berechiah, son of Shimea,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Michael, son of Baaseiah, son of Malchijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Ethni, son of Zerah, son of Adaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Ethan, son of Zimmah, son of Shimei,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Jahath, son of Gershom, son of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the left were their kindred the sons of Merari: Ethan son of Kishi, son of Abdi, son of Malluch,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Hashabiah, son of Amaziah, son of Hilkiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Amzi, son of Bani, son of Shemer,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Mahli, son of Mushi, son of Merari, son of Levi;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their kindred the Levites were appointed for all the service of the tabernacle of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Aaron and his sons made offerings on the altar of burnt offering and on the altar of incense, doing all the work of the most holy place, to make atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zadok his son, Ahimaaz his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are their dwelling places according to their settlements within their territories: to the sons of Aaron of the families of Kohathites—for the lot fell to them first—
speaker: Narrator

text: to them they gave Hebron in the land of Judah and its surrounding pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the fields of the city and its villages they gave to Caleb son of Jephunneh.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the sons of Aaron they gave the cities of refuge: Hebron, Libnah with its pasturelands, Jattir, Eshtemoa with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hilen with its pasturelands, Debir with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashan with its pasturelands, and Beth-shemesh with its pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Benjamin, Geba with its pasturelands, Alemeth with its pasturelands, and Anathoth with its pasturelands. All their towns throughout their families were thirteen.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the rest of the Kohathites were given by lot out of the family of the tribe, out of the half-tribe, the half of Manasseh, ten towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Gershomites according to their families were allotted thirteen towns out of the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and Manasseh in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Merarites according to their families were allotted twelve towns out of the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people of Israel gave the Levites the towns with their pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also gave them by lot out of the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin these towns that are mentioned by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of the families of the sons of Kohath had towns of their territory out of the tribe of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were given the cities of refuge: Shechem with its pasturelands in the hill country of Ephraim, Gezer with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jokmeam with its pasturelands, Beth-horon with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Aijalon with its pasturelands, Gath-rimmon with its pasturelands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and out of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Aner with its pasturelands, and Bileam with its pasturelands, for the rest of the families of the Kohathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Gershomites: out of the half-tribe of Manasseh: Golan in Bashan with its pasturelands and Ashtaroth with its pasturelands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and out of the tribe of Issachar: Kedesh with its pasturelands, Daberath with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ramoth with its pasturelands, and Anem with its pasturelands;
speaker: Narrator

text: out of the tribe of Asher: Mashal with its pasturelands, Abdon with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hukok with its pasturelands, and Rehob with its pasturelands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and out of the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee with its pasturelands, Hammon with its pasturelands, and Kiriathaim with its pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the rest of the Merarites out of the tribe of Zebulun: Rimmono with its pasturelands, Tabor with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: and across the Jordan from Jericho, on the east side of the Jordan, out of the tribe of Reuben: Bezer in the steppe with its pasturelands, Jahzah with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedemoth with its pasturelands, and Mephaath with its pasturelands;
speaker: Narrator

text: and out of the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead with its pasturelands, Mahanaim with its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Heshbon with its pasturelands, and Jazer with its pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Issachar: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Tola: Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their ancestral houses, namely, of Tola, mighty warriors of their generations, their number in the days of David being twenty-two thousand six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Uzzi: Izrahiah. And the sons of Izrahiah: Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah, five, all of them chiefs;
speaker: Narrator

text: and along with them, by their generations, according to their ancestral houses, were units of the fighting force, thirty-six thousand, for they had many wives and sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their kindred belonging to all the families of Issachar were in all eighty-seven thousand mighty warriors, enrolled by genealogy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Benjamin: Bela, Becher, and Jediael, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Bela: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri, five, heads of ancestral houses, mighty warriors; and their enrollment by genealogies was twenty-two thousand thirty-four.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Becher: Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Becher;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their enrollment by genealogies, according to their generations, as heads of their ancestral houses, mighty warriors, was twenty thousand two hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Jediael: Bilhan. And the sons of Bilhan: Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the sons of Jediael according to the heads of their ancestral houses, mighty warriors, seventeen thousand two hundred, ready for service in war.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shuppim and Huppim were the sons of Ir, Hushim the son of Aher.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Naphtali: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum, the descendants of Bilhah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Manasseh: Asriel, whom his Aramean concubine bore; she bore Machir the father of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Machir took a wife for Huppim and for Shuppim. The name of his sister was Maacah. And the name of the second was Zelophehad; and Zelophehad had daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Maacah the wife of Machir bore a son, and she named him Peresh; the name of his brother was Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rekem.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Ulam: Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his sister Hammolecheth bore Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ephraim: Shuthelah, and Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zabad his son, Shuthelah his son, and Ezer and Elead. Now the people of Gath who were born in the land killed them, because they came down to raid their cattle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their father Ephraim mourned many days, and his brothers came to comfort him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ephraim went in to his wife, and she conceived and bore a son, and he named him Beriah, because disaster had befallen his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: His daughter was Sheerah, who built both Lower and Upper Beth-horon and Uzzen-sheerah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rephah was his son, Resheph his son, Telah his son, Tahan his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ladan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nun his son, Joshua his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their possessions and settlements were Bethel and its towns, and eastward Naaran, and westward Gezer and its towns, Shechem and its towns, as far as Ayyah and its towns;
speaker: Narrator

text: also along the borders of the Manassites, Beth-shean and its towns, Taanach and its towns, Megiddo and its towns, Dor and its towns. In these lived the sons of Joseph son of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and their sister Serah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Beriah: Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heber became the father of Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and their sister Shua.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Japhlet: Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These are the sons of Japhlet.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shemer: Ahi, Rohgah, Hubbah, and Aram.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Helem his brother: Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Zophah: Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jether: Jephunneh, Pispa, and Ara.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ulla: Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of these were men of Asher, heads of ancestral houses, select mighty warriors, chief of the princes. Their number enrolled by genealogies, for service in war, was twenty-six thousand men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benjamin became the father of Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Bela had sons: Addar, Gera, Abihud,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the sons of Ehud (they were heads of ancestral houses of the inhabitants of Geba, and they were carried into exile to Manahath):
speaker: Narrator

text: Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera, that is, Heglam, who became the father of Uzza and Ahihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shaharaim had sons in the country of Moab after he had sent away his wives Hushim and Baara.
speaker: Narrator

text: He had sons by his wife Hodesh: Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeuz, Sachia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of ancestral houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also had sons by Hushim: Abitub and Elpaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elpaal: Eber, Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod with its towns,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Beriah and Shema (they were heads of ancestral houses of the inhabitants of Aijalon who put to flight the inhabitants of Gath),
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ahio, Shashak, and Jeremoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
speaker: Narrator

text: Michael, Ishpah, and Joha were the sons of Beriah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abdon, Zichri, Hanan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Iphdeiah, and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jaareshiah, Elijah, and Zichri were the sons of Jeroham.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the heads of ancestral houses, according to their generations, chiefs. These lived in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon, and the name of his wife was Maacah.
speaker: Narrator

text: His firstborn son: Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gedor, Ahio, Zecher,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mikloth, who became the father of Shimeah. Now these also lived opposite their kindred in Jerusalem, with their kindred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ner became the father of Kish, Kish of Saul, Saul of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Esh-baal;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the son of Jonathan was Merib-baal; and Merib-baal became the father of Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz became the father of Jehoaddah; and Jehoaddah became the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri; Zimri became the father of Moza.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moza became the father of Binea; Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azel had six sons, and these are their names: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan; all these were the sons of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of his brother Eshek: Ulam his firstborn, Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ulam were mighty warriors, archers, having many children and grandchildren, one hundred fifty. All these were Benjaminites.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all Israel was enrolled by genealogies, and these are written in the Book of the Kings of Israel. And Judah was taken into exile in Babylon because of their unfaithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the first to live again in their possessions in their towns were Israelites, priests, Levites, and temple servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of the people of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh lived in Jerusalem:
speaker: Narrator

text: Uthai son of Ammihud, son of Omri, son of Imri, son of Bani, from the sons of Perez son of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the Shilonites: Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Zerah: Jeuel and their kin, six hundred ninety.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Benjaminites: Sallu son of Meshullam, son of Hodaviah, son of Hassenuah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ibneiah son of Jeroham, Elah son of Uzzi, son of Michri, and Meshullam son of Shephatiah, son of Reuel, son of Ibnijah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their kindred according to their generations, nine hundred fifty-six. All these were heads of families according to their ancestral houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the priests: Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jachin,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azariah son of Hilkiah, son of Meshullam, son of Zadok, son of Meraioth, son of Ahitub, the chief officer of the house of God;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Adaiah son of Jeroham, son of Pashhur, son of Malchijah, and Maasai son of Adiel, son of Jahzerah, son of Meshullam, son of Meshillemith, son of Immer;
speaker: Narrator

text: besides their kindred, heads of their ancestral houses, one thousand seven hundred sixty, qualified for the work of the service of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Levites: Shemaiah son of Hasshub, son of Azrikam, son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah son of Mica, son of Zichri, son of Asaph;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Obadiah son of Shemaiah, son of Galal, son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah son of Asa, son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gatekeepers were: Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman; and their kinsman Shallum was the chief,
speaker: Narrator

text: stationed previously in the king’s gate on the east side. These were the gatekeepers of the camp of the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum son of Kore, son of Ebiasaph, son of Korah, and his kindred of his ancestral house, the Korahites, were in charge of the work of the service, guardians of the thresholds of the tent, as their ancestors had been in charge of the camp of the Lord, guardians of the entrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Phinehas son of Eleazar was chief over them in former times; the Lord was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was gatekeeper at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these who were chosen as gatekeepers at the thresholds were two hundred twelve. They were enrolled by genealogies in their villages. David and the seer Samuel established them in their office of trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they and their descendants were in charge of the gates of the house of the Lord, that is, the house of the tent, as guards.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gatekeepers were on the four sides: east, west, north, and south;
speaker: Narrator

text: and their kindred who were in their villages were obliged to come in every seven days, in turn, to be with them,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the four chief gatekeepers, who were Levites, were in charge of the chambers and the treasures of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they would spend the night near the house of God, for on them lay the duty of watching, and they had charge of opening it every morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of them had charge of the utensils of service, for they were required to count them when they were brought in and taken out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Others of them were appointed over the furniture and over all the holy utensils, also over the choice flour, the wine, the oil, the incense, and the spices.
speaker: Narrator

text: Others of the sons of the priests prepared the mixing of the spices,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mattithiah, one of the Levites, the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, was in charge of making the flat cakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also some of their kindred of the Kohathites had charge of the rows of bread, to prepare them for each Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the singers, the heads of ancestral houses of the Levites, living in the chambers of the temple free from other service, for they were on duty day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were heads of ancestral houses of the Levites, according to their generations; these leaders lived in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Gibeon lived the father of Gibeon, Jeiel, and the name of his wife was Maacah.
speaker: Narrator

text: His firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mikloth became the father of Shimeam; and these also lived opposite their kindred in Jerusalem, with their kindred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ner became the father of Kish, Kish of Saul, Saul of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Esh-baal;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the son of Jonathan was Merib-baal; and Merib-baal became the father of Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ahaz became the father of Jarah, and Jarah of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri became the father of Moza.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moza became the father of Binea; and Rephaiah was his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azel had six sons, and these are their names: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan; these were the sons of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Philistines fought against Israel, and the men of Israel fled before the Philistines and fell slain on Mount Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Philistines overtook Saul and his sons, and the Philistines killed Jonathan and Abinadab and Malchishua, the sons of Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The battle pressed hard on Saul, and the archers found him, and he was wounded by the archers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul said to his armor-bearer, “Draw your sword and thrust me through with it, so that these uncircumcised may not come and make sport of me.” But his armor-bearer was unwilling, for he was terrified. So Saul took his own sword and fell on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he also fell on his sword and died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Saul died; he and his three sons and all his house died together.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that the army had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their towns and fled, and the Philistines came and occupied them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day when the Philistines came to strip the dead, they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stripped him and took his head and his armor and sent messengers throughout the land of the Philistines to carry the good news to their idols and to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They put his armor in the temple of their gods and fastened his head in the temple of Dagon.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when all Jabesh-gilead heard everything that the Philistines had done to Saul,
speaker: Narrator

text: all the valiant warriors got up and took away the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons and brought them to Jabesh. Then they buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh and fasted seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Saul died for his unfaithfulness; he was unfaithful to the Lord in that he did not keep the command of the Lord; moreover, he had consulted a medium, seeking guidance,
speaker: Narrator

text: and did not seek guidance from the Lord. Therefore the Lord put him to death and turned the kingdom over to David son of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all Israel gathered together to David at Hebron and said, “Look, we are your bone and flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For some time now, even while Saul was king, it was you who commanded the army of Israel. The Lord your God said to you, ‘It is you who shall be shepherd of my people Israel, you who shall be ruler over my people Israel.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, and David made a covenant with them at Hebron before the Lord. And they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the Lord by Samuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David and all Israel marched to Jerusalem, that is, Jebus, where the Jebusites were, the inhabitants of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The inhabitants of Jebus said to David, “You will not come in here.” Nevertheless, David took the stronghold of Zion, now the city of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: David had said, “Whoever attacks the Jebusites first shall be chief and commander.” And Joab son of Zeruiah went up first, so he became chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: David resided in the stronghold; therefore it was called the city of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: He built the city all around, from the Millo in complete circuit, and Joab repaired the rest of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David became greater and greater, for the Lord of hosts was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the chiefs of David’s warriors, who gave him strong support in his kingdom, together with all Israel, to make him king, according to the word of the Lord concerning Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is an account of David’s mighty warriors: Jashobeam, son of Hachmoni, was chief of the Three; he wielded his spear against three hundred whom he killed at one time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And next to him among the three warriors was Eleazar son of Dodo, the Ahohite.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was with David at Pas-dammim when the Philistines were gathered there for battle. There was a plot of ground full of barley. Now the people had fled from the Philistines,
speaker: Narrator

text: but he and David took their stand in the middle of the plot, defended it, and killed the Philistines, and the Lord saved them by a great victory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three of the thirty chiefs went down to the rock to David at the cave of Adullam while the army of Philistines was encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was then in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then at Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said longingly, “Oh, that someone would give me water to drink from the well of Bethlehem that is by the gate!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Three broke through the camp of the Philistines and drew water from the well of Bethlehem that was by the gate, and they brought it to David. But David would not drink of it; he poured it out to the Lord
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “My God forbid that I should do this. Can I drink the blood of these men? For at the risk of their lives they brought it.” Therefore he would not drink it. The three warriors did these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Abishai, the brother of Joab, was chief of the Thirty. With his spear he fought against three hundred and killed them and won a name beside the Three.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was the most renowned of the Thirty and became their commander, but he did not attain to the Three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a valiant man of Kabzeel, a doer of great deeds; he struck down two sons of Ariel of Moab. He also went down and killed a lion in a pit on a day when snow had fallen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he killed an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits tall. The Egyptian had in his hand a spear like a weaver’s beam, but Benaiah went against him with a staff, snatched the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and killed him with his own spear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such were the things Benaiah son of Jehoiada did, and he won a name beside the three warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was renowned among the Thirty, but he did not attain to the Three. And David put him in charge of his bodyguard.
speaker: Narrator

text: The warriors of the armies were Asahel brother of Joab, Elhanan son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shammoth of Harod, Helez the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ira son of Ikkesh of Tekoa, Abiezer of Anathoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Maharai of Netophah, Heled son of Baanah of Netophah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ithai son of Ribai of Gibeah of the Benjaminites, Benaiah of Pirathon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hurai of the wadis of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Azmaveth of Bahurim, Eliahba of Shaalbon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan son of Shagee the Hararite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahiam son of Sachar the Hararite, Eliphal son of Ur,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezro of Carmel, Naarai son of Ezbai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar son of Hagri,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai of Beeroth (the armor-bearer of Joab son of Zeruiah),
speaker: Narrator

text: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad son of Ahlai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adina son of Shiza the Reubenite, a leader of the Reubenites, and thirty with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hanan son of Maacah, and Joshaphat the Mithnite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel sons of Hotham the Aroerite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jediael son of Shimri and his brother Joha the Tizite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliel the Mahavite, and Jeribai and Joshaviah sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliel, and Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
speaker: Narrator

text: The following are those who came to David at Ziklag, while he could not move about freely because of Saul son of Kish; they were among the mighty warriors who helped him in war.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were archers and could shoot arrows and sling stones with either the right hand or the left; they were Benjaminites, Saul’s kindred.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, both sons of Shemaah of Gibeah; also Jeziel and Pelet sons of Azmaveth; Beracah, Jehu of Anathoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishmaiah of Gibeon, a warrior among the Thirty and a leader over the Thirty; Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, Jozabad of Gederah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, Shephatiah the Haruphite;
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, and Jashobeam, the Korahites;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joelah and Zebadiah, sons of Jeroham of Gedor.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Gadites there went over to David at the stronghold in the wilderness mighty and experienced warriors, expert with shield and spear, whose faces were like the faces of lions and who were swift as gazelles on the mountains:
speaker: Narrator

text: Ezer the chief, Obadiah second, Eliab third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishmannah fourth, Jeremiah fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Attai sixth, Eliel seventh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Johanan eighth, Elzabad ninth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeremiah tenth, Machbannai eleventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: These Gadites were officers of the army, the least equal to a hundred and the greatest to a thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the men who crossed the Jordan in the first month, when it was overflowing all its banks, and put to flight all those in the valleys to the east and to the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some Benjaminites and Judahites came to the stronghold to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: David went out to meet them and said to them, “If you have come to me in friendship, to help me, then my heart will be knit to you, but if you have come to betray me to my adversaries, though my hands have done no wrong, then may the God of our ancestors see and give judgment.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the spirit came upon Amasai, chief of the Thirty, and he said,
“We are yours, O David,
    and with you, O son of Jesse!
Peace, peace to you,
    and peace to the one who helps you!
    For your God is the one who helps you.”
Then David received them and made them officers of his troops.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the Manassites deserted to David when he came with the Philistines for the battle against Saul. (Yet he did not help them, for the rulers of the Philistines took counsel and sent him away, saying, “He will desert to his master Saul at the cost of our heads.”)
speaker: Narrator

text: As he went to Ziklag these Manassites deserted to him: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, chiefs of the thousands in Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They helped David against the band of raiders, for they were all warriors and commanders in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, from day to day people kept coming to David to help him until there was a great army, like an army of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the numbers of the divisions of the armed troops who came to David in Hebron to turn the kingdom of Saul over to him, according to the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of Judah bearing shield and spear numbered six thousand eight hundred armed troops.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Simeonites, mighty warriors, seven thousand one hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Levites four thousand six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehoiada, leader of the house of Aaron, and with him three thousand seven hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zadok, a young warrior, and twenty-two commanders from his own ancestral house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Benjaminites, the kindred of Saul, three thousand, of whom the majority had continued to keep their allegiance to the house of Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Ephraimites, twenty thousand eight hundred, mighty warriors, notables in their ancestral houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the half-tribe of Manasseh, eighteen thousand, who were expressly named to come and make David king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Issachar, those who had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do, two hundred chiefs, and all their kindred under their command.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Zebulun, fifty thousand seasoned troops equipped for battle with all the weapons of war to help David with singleness of purpose.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Naphtali, a thousand commanders, with whom there were thirty-seven thousand armed with shield and spear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Danites, twenty-eight thousand six hundred equipped for battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Asher, forty thousand seasoned troops ready for battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Reubenites and Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh from beyond the Jordan, one hundred twenty thousand armed with all the weapons of war.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these, warriors arrayed in battle order, came to Hebron with full intent to make David king over all Israel; likewise all the rest of Israel were of a single mind to make David king.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were there with David for three days, eating and drinking, for their kindred had provided for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And also their neighbors from as far away as Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali came bringing food on donkeys, camels, mules, and oxen—abundant provisions of meal, cakes of figs, clusters of raisins, wine, oil, oxen, and sheep, for there was joy in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David consulted with the commanders of the thousands and of the hundreds, with every leader.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to the whole assembly of Israel, “If it seems good to you, and if it is the will of the Lord our God, let us send abroad to our kindred who remain in all the land of Israel, including the priests and Levites in the cities that have pasturelands, that they may come together to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then let us bring again the ark of our God to us, for we did not seek it in the days of Saul.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The whole assembly agreed to do so, for the thing pleased all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David assembled all Israel from the Shihor of Egypt to Lebo-hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David and all Israel went up to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath-jearim, which belongs to Judah, to bring up from there the ark of God, the Lord, who is enthroned on the cherubim, which is called by his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: They carried the ark of God on a new cart from the house of Abinadab, and Uzzah and Ahio were driving the cart.
speaker: Narrator

text: David and all Israel were dancing before God with all their might, with songs and lyres and harps and tambourines and cymbals and trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzzah put out his hand to hold the ark, for the oxen lurched.
speaker: Narrator

text: The anger of the Lord was kindled against Uzzah; he struck him down because he put out his hand to the ark, and he died there before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was angry because the Lord had burst out against Uzzah, so that place is called Perez-uzzah to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was afraid of God that day; he said, “How can I bring the ark of God into my care?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So David did not take the ark into his care into the city of David; he took it instead to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ark of God remained with the household of Obed-edom in his house three months, and the Lord blessed the household of Obed-edom and all that he had.
speaker: Narrator

text: King Hiram of Tyre sent messengers to David, along with cedar logs and masons and carpenters to build a house for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: David then perceived that the Lord had established him as king over Israel and that his kingdom was highly exalted for the sake of his people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David took more wives in Jerusalem, and David became the father of more sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the children whom he had in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, and Nathan; Solomon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ibhar, Elishua, and Elpelet;
speaker: Narrator

text: Nogah, Nepheg, and Japhia;
speaker: Narrator

text: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up in search of David, but David heard about it and went out against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Philistines had come and made a raid in the valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David inquired of God, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? Will you give them into my hand?” The Lord said to him, “Go up, and I will give them into your hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went up to Baal-perazim, and David defeated them there. David said, “God has burst forth against my enemies by my hand, like a bursting flood.” Therefore that place is called Baal-perazim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They abandoned their gods there, and at David’s command they were burned.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once again the Philistines made a raid in the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David again inquired of God, God said to him, “You shall not go up after them; go around and come upon them opposite the balsam trees.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, then go out to battle, for God has gone out before you to strike down the army of the Philistines.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David did as God had commanded him, and they struck down the Philistine army from Gibeon to Gezer.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fame of David went out into all lands, and the Lord brought the fear of him on all nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: David built houses for himself in the city of David, and he prepared a place for the ark of God and pitched a tent for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David commanded that no one but the Levites were to carry the ark of God, for the Lord had chosen them to carry the ark of the Lord and to minister to him forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: David assembled all Israel in Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the Lord to its place, which he had prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David gathered together the descendants of Aaron and the Levites:
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Kohath, Uriel the chief, with one hundred twenty of his kindred;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Merari, Asaiah the chief, with two hundred twenty of his kindred;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Gershom, Joel the chief, with one hundred thirty of his kindred;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief, with two hundred of his kindred;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Hebron, Eliel the chief, with eighty of his kindred;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the sons of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief, with one hundred twelve of his kindred.
speaker: Narrator

text: David summoned the priests Zadok and Abiathar and the Levites Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “You are the heads of families of the Levites; sanctify yourselves, you and your kindred, so that you may bring up the ark of the Lord, the God of Israel, to the place that I have prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because you did not carry it the first time, the Lord our God burst out against us because we did not give it proper care.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of the Lord, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Levites carried the ark of God on their shoulders with the poles, as Moses had commanded according to the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: David also commanded the chiefs of the Levites to appoint their kindred as singers to raise loud sounds of joy on musical instruments, on harps and lyres and cymbals.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Levites appointed Heman son of Joel; and of his kindred Asaph son of Berechiah; and of the sons of Merari, their kindred, Ethan son of Kushaiah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and with them their kindred of the second order, Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, and Mikneiah, and the gatekeepers Obed-edom and Jeiel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The singers Heman, Asaph, and Ethan were to sound bronze cymbals;
speaker: Narrator

text: Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah were to play harps according to Alamoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: but Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah were to lead with lyres according to the Sheminith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chenaniah, leader of the Levites in music, was to direct the music, for he understood it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Berechiah and Elkanah were to be gatekeepers for the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, were to blow the trumpets before the ark of God. Obed-edom and Jehiah also were to be gatekeepers for the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David and the elders of Israel and the commanders of the thousands went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord from the house of Obed-edom with rejoicing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And because God helped the Levites who were carrying the ark of the covenant of the Lord, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, as also were all the Levites who were carrying the ark, and the singers, and Chenaniah the leader of the music of the singers, and David wore a linen ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the Lord with shouting, to the sound of the horn, trumpets, and cymbals, and made loud music on harps and lyres.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the ark of the covenant of the Lord came to the city of David, Michal daughter of Saul looked out of the window and saw King David leaping and dancing, and she despised him in her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought in the ark of God and set it inside the tent that David had pitched for it, and they offered burnt offerings and offerings of well-being before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David had finished offering the burnt offerings and the offerings of well-being, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he distributed to every person in Israel—man and woman alike—to each a loaf of bread, a portion of meat, and a cake of raisins.
speaker: Narrator

text: He appointed certain of the Levites as ministers before the ark of the Lord, to invoke, to thank, and to praise the Lord, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Asaph was the chief, and second to him was Zechariah, Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel, with harps and lyres; Asaph was to sound the cymbals,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the priests Benaiah and Jahaziel were to blow trumpets regularly before the ark of the covenant of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then on that day David first appointed the singing of praises to the Lord by Asaph and his kindred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O give thanks to the Lord, call on his name,
    make known his deeds among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to him, sing praises to him;
    tell of all his wonderful works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Glory in his holy name;
    let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek the Lord and his strength;
    seek his presence continually.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember the wonderful works he has done,
    his miracles and the judgments he uttered,
speaker: Narrator

text:
O offspring of his servant Israel,
    children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the Lord our God;
    his judgments are in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember his covenant forever,
    the word that he commanded for a thousand generations,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the covenant that he made with Abraham,
    his sworn promise to Isaac,
speaker: Narrator

text:
which he confirmed to Jacob as a statute,
    to Israel as an everlasting covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
    as your portion for an inheritance.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they were few in number,
    of little account, and strangers in the land,
speaker: Narrator

text:
wandering from nation to nation,
    from one kingdom to another people,
speaker: Narrator

text:
he allowed no one to oppress them;
    he rebuked kings on their account,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying, “Do not touch my anointed ones;
    do my prophets no harm.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord, all the earth.
    Tell of his salvation from day to day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Declare his glory among the nations,
    his marvelous works among all the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For great is the Lord and greatly to be praised;
    he is to be revered above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all the gods of the peoples are idols,
    but the Lord made the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Honor and majesty are before him;
    strength and joy are in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to the Lord, O families of the peoples,
    ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
tremble before him, all the earth.
    The world is firmly established; it shall never be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice,
    and let them say among the nations, “The Lord is king!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the sea roar and all that fills it;
    let the field exult and everything in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then shall the trees of the forest sing for joy
    before the Lord, for he comes to judge the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
    for his steadfast love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Say also,
“Save us, O God of our salvation,
    and gather and rescue us from among the nations,
that we may give thanks to your holy name
    and glory in your praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
    from everlasting to everlasting.”
Then all the people said “Amen!” and praised the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: David left Asaph and his kinsfolk there before the ark of the covenant of the Lord to minister regularly before the ark as each day required,
speaker: Narrator

text: and also Obed-edom and his sixty-eight kinsfolk, while Obed-edom son of Jeduthun and Hosah were to be gatekeepers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he left the priest Zadok and his kindred the priests before the tabernacle of the Lord in the high place that was at Gibeon,
speaker: Narrator

text: to offer burnt offerings to the Lord on the altar of burnt offering regularly, morning and evening, according to all that is written in the law of the Lord that he commanded Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: With them were Heman and Jeduthun and the rest of those chosen and expressly named to render thanks to the Lord, for his steadfast love endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heman and Jeduthun had with them trumpets and cymbals for the music and instruments for sacred song. The sons of Jeduthun were appointed to the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the people departed to their homes, and David went home to bless his household.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when David settled in his house, David said to the prophet Nathan, “I am living in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of the Lord is under a tent.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nathan said to David, “Do all that you have in mind, for God is with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But that same night the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go and tell my servant David: Thus says the Lord: You shall not build me a house to live in.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have not lived in a house since the day I brought out Israel to this very day, but I have lived in a tent and a tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherever I have moved about among all Israel, did I ever speak a word with any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to shepherd my people, saying, ‘Why have you not built me a house of cedar?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore thus you shall say to my servant David: Thus says the Lord of hosts: I took you from the pasture, from following the sheep, to be ruler over my people Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and I have been with you wherever you went and have cut off all your enemies before you, and I will make for you a name like the name of the great ones of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will appoint a place for my people Israel and will plant them, so that they may live in their own place and be disturbed no more, and evildoers shall wear them down no more, as they did formerly,
speaker: Narrator

text: from the time that I appointed judges over my people Israel, and I will subdue all your enemies. Moreover, I declare to you that the Lord will build you a house.
speaker: Narrator

text: When your days are fulfilled to go to be with your ancestors, I will raise up your offspring after you, one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall build a house for me, and I will establish his throne forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will be a father to him, and he shall be a son to me. I will not take my steadfast love from him, as I took it from him who was before you,
speaker: Narrator

text: but I will confirm him in my house and in my kingdom forever, and his throne shall be established forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In accordance with all these words and all this vision, Nathan spoke to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King David went in and sat before the Lord and said, “Who am I, O Lord God, and what is my house, that you have brought me thus far?
speaker: Narrator

text: And even this was a small thing in your sight, O God; you have also spoken of your servant’s house into the distant future. You regard me as someone of high rank, O Lord God!
speaker: Narrator

text: And what more can David say to you for honoring your servant? You know your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: For your servant’s sake, O Lord, and according to your own heart, you have done all these great deeds, making known all these great things.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no one like you, O Lord, and there is no God besides you, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is like your people Israel, one nation on the earth whom God went to redeem to be his people, making for yourself a name for great and awesome things, in driving out nations before your people whom you redeemed from Egypt?
speaker: Narrator

text: And you made your people Israel to be your people forever, and you, O Lord, became their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, O Lord, as for the word that you have spoken concerning your servant and concerning his house, let it be established forever, and do as you have promised.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus your name will be established and magnified forever in the saying, ‘The Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, is Israel’s God,’ and the house of your servant David will be established in your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build a house for him; therefore your servant has found it possible to pray before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, O Lord, you are God, and you have promised this good thing to your servant;
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore may it please you to bless the house of your servant so that it may continue forever before you. For you, O Lord, have blessed and are blessed forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Some time afterward, David attacked the Philistines and subdued them; he took Gath and its villages from the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: He defeated Moab, and the Moabites became subject to David and brought tribute.
speaker: Narrator

text: David also struck down King Hadadezer of Zobah, toward Hamath, as he went to set up a monument at the River Euphrates.
speaker: Narrator

text: David took from him one thousand chariots, seven thousand cavalry, and twenty thousand foot soldiers. David hamstrung all the chariot horses but left one hundred of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Arameans of Damascus came to help King Hadadezer of Zobah, David killed twenty-two thousand Arameans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David put garrisons in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans became subject to David and brought tribute. The Lord gave victory to David wherever he went.
speaker: Narrator

text: David took the gold shields that were carried by the servants of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Tibhath and from Cun, cities of Hadadezer, David took a vast quantity of bronze; with it Solomon made the bronze sea and the pillars and the vessels of bronze.
speaker: Narrator
