text: When King Tou of Hamath heard that David had defeated the whole army of King Hadadezer of Zobah,
speaker: Narrator

text: he sent his son Hadoram to King David, to greet him and to congratulate him because he had fought against Hadadezer and defeated him. Now Hadadezer had often been at war with Tou. He sent all sorts of articles of gold, of silver, and of bronze;
speaker: Narrator

text: these also King David dedicated to the Lord, together with the silver and gold that he had carried off from all the nations, from Edom, Moab, the Ammonites, the Philistines, and Amalek.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishai son of Zeruiah killed eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became subject to David. And the Lord gave victory to David wherever he went.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David reigned over all Israel, and he administered justice and equity to all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;
speaker: Narrator

text: Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelech son of Abiathar were priests; Shavsha was secretary;
speaker: Narrator

text: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David’s sons were the chief officials in the service of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some time afterward, King Nahash of the Ammonites died, and his son succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said, “I will deal loyally with Hanun son of Nahash, for his father dealt loyally with me.” So David sent messengers to console him concerning his father. When David’s servants came to Hanun in the land of the Ammonites to console him,
speaker: Narrator

text: the officials of the Ammonites said to Hanun, “Do you think, because David has sent consolers to you, that he is honoring your father? Have not his servants come to you to search and to overthrow and to spy out the land?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Hanun seized David’s servants, shaved them, cut off their garments in the middle at their waists, and sent them away,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they departed. When David was told about the men, he sent messengers to them, for they felt greatly humiliated. The king said, “Remain at Jericho until your beards have grown and then return.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Ammonites saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the Ammonites sent a thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and cavalry from Aram-naharaim, from Aram-maacah, and from Zobah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They hired thirty-two thousand chariots and the king of Maacah with his army, who came and camped before Medeba. And the Ammonites were mustered from their cities and came to battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David heard of it, he sent Joab and all the army of the warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Ammonites came out and drew up in battle array at the entrance of the city, and the kings who had come were by themselves in the open country.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Joab saw that the line of battle was set against him both in front and in the rear, he chose some of the picked men of Israel and arrayed them against the Arameans;
speaker: Narrator

text: the rest of his troops he put in the charge of his brother Abishai, and they were arrayed against the Ammonites.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “If the Arameans are too strong for me, then you shall help me, but if the Ammonites are too strong for you, then I will help you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be strong, and let us be courageous for our people and for the cities of our God, and may the Lord do what seems good to him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joab and the troops who were with him advanced toward the Arameans for battle, and they fled before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Ammonites saw that the Arameans fled, they likewise fled before Abishai, Joab’s brother, and entered the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Arameans saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they sent messengers and brought out the Arameans who were beyond the River, with Shophach the commander of the army of Hadadezer at their head.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David was informed, he gathered all Israel together, crossed the Jordan, came to them, and drew up his forces against them. When David set the battle in array against the Arameans, they fought with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Arameans fled before Israel, and David killed seven thousand Aramean charioteers and forty thousand foot soldiers and also Shophach the commander of their army.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the servants of Hadadezer saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and became subject to him. So the Arameans were not willing to help the Ammonites any more.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the spring of the year, the time when kings go out to battle, Joab led out the army, ravaged the country of the Ammonites, and came and besieged Rabbah. But David remained at Jerusalem. Joab attacked Rabbah and overthrew it.
speaker: Narrator

text: David took the crown of Milcom from his head; he found that it weighed a talent of gold, and in it was a precious stone, and it was placed on David’s head. He also brought out the spoil of the city, a very great amount.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought out the people who were in it and set them to work with saws and iron picks and axes. Thus David did to all the cities of the Ammonites. Then David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, war broke out with the Philistines at Gezer; then Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, who was one of the descendants of the giants, and the Philistines were subdued.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again there was war with the Philistines, and Elhanan son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again there was war at Gath, where there was a man of great size who had six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot, twenty-four in number; he also was descended from the giants.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he taunted Israel, Jonathan son of Shimea, David’s brother, killed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were descended from the giants in Gath; they fell by the hand of David and his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Satan stood up against Israel and incited David to count the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David said to Joab and the commanders of the army, “Go, number Israel, from Beer-sheba to Dan, and bring me a report, so that I may know their number.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Joab said, “May the Lord increase the number of his people a hundredfold! Are they not, my lord the king, all of them my lord’s servants? Why then should my lord require this? Why should he bring guilt on Israel?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the king’s word prevailed against Joab. So Joab departed and went throughout all Israel and came back to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joab gave the total count of the people to David. In all Israel there were one million one hundred thousand men who drew the sword, and in Judah four hundred seventy thousand who drew the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he did not include Levi and Benjamin in the numbering, for the king’s command was abhorrent to Joab.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God was displeased with this thing, and he struck Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to God, “I have sinned greatly in that I have done this thing. But now, please remove the guilt of your servant, for I have done very foolishly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Gad, David’s seer, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go and say to David: Thus says the Lord: Three things I offer you; choose one of them, so that I may do it to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Gad came to David and said to him, “Thus says the Lord: Take your choice:
speaker: Narrator

text: either three years of famine; or three months of devastation by your foes, while the sword of your enemies overtakes you; or three days of the sword of the Lord, pestilence on the land, and the angel of the Lord destroying throughout all the territory of Israel. Now decide what answer I shall return to the one who sent me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said to Gad, “I am in great distress; let me fall into the hand of the Lord, for his mercy is very great, but let me not fall into human hands.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord sent a pestilence on Israel, and seventy thousand persons fell in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it, but when he was about to destroy it, the Lord took note and relented concerning the calamity; he said to the destroying angel, “Enough! Stay your hand.” The angel of the Lord was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text: David looked up and saw the angel of the Lord standing between earth and heaven and in his hand a drawn sword stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell on their faces.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said to God, “Was it not I who gave the command to count the people? It is I who have sinned and done very wickedly. But these sheep, what have they done? Let your hand, I pray, O Lord my God, be against me and against my father’s house, but do not let your people be plagued!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the angel of the Lord commanded Gad to tell David that he should go up and erect an altar to the Lord on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David went up following Gad’s instructions, which he had spoken in the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ornan turned and saw the king, and while his four sons who were with him hid themselves, Ornan continued to thresh wheat.
speaker: Narrator

text: As David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David; he went out from the threshing floor and prostrated himself before David with his face to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to Ornan, “Give me the site of the threshing floor that I may build on it an altar to the Lord—give it to me at its full price—so that the plague may be averted from the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Ornan said to David, “Take it, and let my lord the king do what seems good to him; see, I present the oxen for burnt offerings and the threshing sledges for the wood and the wheat for a grain offering. I give it all.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But King David said to Ornan, “No, but I will buy them for the full price. I will not take for the Lord what is yours nor offer burnt offerings that cost me nothing.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So David paid Ornan six hundred shekels of gold by weight for the site.
speaker: Narrator

text: David built there an altar to the Lord and presented burnt offerings and offerings of well-being. He called upon the Lord, and he answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord commanded the angel, and he put his sword back into its sheath.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time, when David saw that the Lord had answered him at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he made his sacrifices there.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the tabernacle of the Lord that Moses had made in the wilderness and the altar of burnt offering were at that time in the high place at Gibeon,
speaker: Narrator

text: but David could not go before it to inquire of God, for he was afraid of the sword of the angel of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said, “Here shall be the house of the Lord God and here the altar of burnt offering for Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David gave orders to gather together the aliens who were residing in the land of Israel, and he set stonecutters to prepare dressed stones for building the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: David also provided great stores of iron for nails for the doors of the gates and for clamps, as well as bronze in quantities beyond weighing,
speaker: Narrator

text: and cedar logs without number—for the Sidonians and Tyrians brought great quantities of cedar to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: For David said, “My son Solomon is young and inexperienced, and the house that is to be built for the Lord must be exceedingly magnificent, famous and glorified throughout all lands; I will therefore make preparation for it.” So David provided materials in great quantity before his death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he called for his son Solomon and charged him to build a house for the Lord, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to Solomon, “My son, I had planned to build a house to the name of the Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word of the Lord came to me, saying, ‘You have shed much blood and have waged great wars; you shall not build a house to my name because you have shed so much blood in my sight on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, a son shall be born to you; he shall be a man of rest. I will give him rest from all his enemies on every side; indeed, his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quiet to Israel in his days.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall build a house for my name. He shall be a son to me, and I will be a father to him, and I will establish his royal throne in Israel forever.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, my son, the Lord be with you, so that you may succeed in building the house of the Lord your God, as he has spoken concerning you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only, may the Lord grant you discretion and understanding, so that when he gives you charge over Israel you may keep the law of the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you will prosper, if you are careful to observe the statutes and the ordinances that the Lord commanded Moses for Israel. Be strong and of good courage. Do not be afraid or dismayed.
speaker: Narrator

text: With great pains I have provided for the house of the Lord one hundred thousand talents of gold, one million talents of silver, and bronze and iron beyond weighing, for there is so much of it; timber and stone also I have provided. To these you must add more.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have an abundance of workers: stonecutters, masons, carpenters, and all kinds of artisans without number, skilled in working
speaker: Narrator

text: gold, silver, bronze, and iron. Now begin the work, and the Lord be with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David also commanded all the leaders of Israel to help his son Solomon, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Is not the Lord your God with you? Has he not given you rest on every side? For he has delivered the inhabitants of the land into my hand, and the land is subdued before the Lord and his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now set your mind and heart to seek the Lord your God. Go and build the sanctuary of the Lord God so that the ark of the covenant of the Lord and the holy vessels of God may be brought into the house built for the name of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When David was old and full of days, he made his son Solomon king over Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David assembled all the leaders of Israel and the priests and the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites, thirty years old and up, were counted, and the total head count of men was thirty-eight thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Twenty-four thousand of these,” David said, “shall have charge of the work in the house of the Lord, six thousand shall be officers and judges,
speaker: Narrator

text: four thousand gatekeepers, and four thousand shall offer praises to the Lord with the instruments that I have made for praise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And David organized them in divisions corresponding to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gershon were Ladan and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the chief, Zetham, and Joel, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth, Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the heads of families of Ladan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jahath was the chief and Zizah the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, so they were enrolled as a single family.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. Aaron was set apart to consecrate the most holy things, so that he and his sons forever should make offerings before the Lord and minister to him and pronounce blessings in his name forever,
speaker: Narrator

text: but as for Moses the man of God, his sons were to be reckoned among the tribe of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Gershom: Shebuel the chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Eliezer: Rehabiah the chief; Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very numerous.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Izhar: Shelomith the chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Uzziel: Micah the chief and Isshiah the second.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar died having no sons but only daughters; their kindred, the sons of Kish, married them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth, three.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Levi by their ancestral houses, the heads of families as they were enrolled according to the number of the names of the individuals from twenty years old and up who were to do the work for the service of the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For David said, “The Lord, the God of Israel, has given rest to his people, and he resides in Jerusalem forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so the Levites no longer need to carry the tabernacle or any of the things for its service”—
speaker: Narrator

text: for according to the last words of David these were the number of the Levites from twenty years old and up—
speaker: Narrator

text: “but their duty shall be to assist the descendants of Aaron for the service of the house of the Lord, having the care of the courts and the chambers, the cleansing of all that is holy, and any work for the service of the house of God;
speaker: Narrator

text: to assist also with the rows of bread, the choice flour for the grain offering, the wafers of unleavened bread, the baked offering, the offering mixed with oil, and all measures of quantity or size.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall stand every morning thanking and praising the Lord, and likewise at evening,
speaker: Narrator

text: and whenever burnt offerings are offered to the Lord on Sabbaths, new moons, and appointed festivals, according to the number required of them, regularly before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they shall keep charge of the tent of meeting and the sanctuary and shall attend the descendants of Aaron, their kindred, for the service of the house of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The divisions of the descendants of Aaron were these. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father and had no sons, so Eleazar and Ithamar became the priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: Along with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, David organized them according to the appointed duties in their service.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since more chief men were found among the sons of Eleazar than among the sons of Ithamar, they organized them under sixteen heads of ancestral houses of the sons of Eleazar and eight of the sons of Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: They organized them by lot, all alike, for there were officers of the sanctuary and officers of God among both the sons of Eleazar and the sons of Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The scribe Shemaiah son of Nethanel, a Levite, recorded them in the presence of the king, and the officers, and Zadok the priest, and Ahimelech son of Abiathar, and the heads of ancestral houses of the priests and of the Levites—one ancestral house being chosen for Eleazar and one chosen for Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first lot fell to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
speaker: Narrator

text: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
speaker: Narrator

text: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
speaker: Narrator

text: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,
speaker: Narrator

text: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezkel,
speaker: Narrator

text: the twenty-first to Jachin, the twenty-second to Gamul,
speaker: Narrator

text: the twenty-third to Delaiah, the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These had as their appointed duty in their service to enter the house of the Lord according to the procedure established for them by their ancestor Aaron, as the Lord God of Israel had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the rest of the sons of Levi: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, Isshiah the chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Izharites, Shelomoth; of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Uzziel, Micah; of the sons of Micah, Shamir.
speaker: Narrator

text: The brother of Micah, Isshiah; of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Jaaziah: Beno.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Merari: of Jaaziah, Beno, Shoham, Zaccur, and Ibri.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Kish, the sons of Kish: Jerahmeel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites according to their ancestral houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: These also cast lots corresponding to their kindred, the descendants of Aaron, in the presence of King David, Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of ancestral houses of the priests and of the Levites, the chief as well as the youngest brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: David and the officers of the army also set apart for the service the sons of Asaph, and of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who should prophesy with lyres, harps, and cymbals. The list of those who did the work and of their duties was:
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asarelah, sons of Asaph, under the direction of Asaph, who prophesied under the direction of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the direction of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with the lyre in thanksgiving and praise to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of Heman, the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the sons of Heman the king’s seer, according to the promise of God to exalt him, for God had given Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were all under the direction of their father for the music in the house of the Lord with cymbals, harps, and lyres for the service of the house of God. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman were under the order of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: They and their kindred, who were trained in singing to the Lord, all of whom were skillful, numbered two hundred eighty-eight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cast lots for their duties, small and great, teacher and pupil alike.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first lot fell for Asaph to Joseph; the second to Gedaliah, to him and his brothers and his sons, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the third to Zaccur, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fourth to Izri, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the fifth to Nethaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the sixth to Bukkiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the seventh to Jesarelah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the eighth to Jeshaiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the tenth to Shimei, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the eleventh to Azarel, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the thirteenth, Shubael, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the fourteenth, Mattithiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the fifteenth, to Jeremoth, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the sixteenth, to Hananiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the seventeenth, to Joshbekashah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the eighteenth, to Hanani, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the nineteenth, to Mallothi, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the twentieth, to Eliathah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the twenty-first, to Hothir, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the twenty-second, to Giddalti, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the twenty-third, to Mahazioth, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
speaker: Narrator

text: to the twenty-fourth, to Romamti-ezer, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the divisions of the gatekeepers: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Obed-edom had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sachar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peullethai the eighth; for God blessed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also to his son Shemaiah sons were born who exercised authority in their ancestral houses, for they were men of great ability.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose brothers were able men, Elihu and Semachiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these, sons of Obed-edom with their sons and brothers, were able men qualified for the service; sixty-two of Obed-edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshelemiah had sons and brothers, able men, eighteen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hosah, of the sons of Merari, had sons: Shimri the chief (for though he was not the firstborn, his father made him chief),
speaker: Narrator

text: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth; all the sons and brothers of Hosah totaled thirteen.
speaker: Narrator

text: These divisions of the gatekeepers, corresponding to their leaders, had duties, just as their kindred did, ministering in the house of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they cast lots by ancestral houses, small and great alike, for their gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lot for the east fell to Shelemiah. They cast lots also for his son Zechariah, a prudent counselor, and his lot came out for the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: Obed-edom’s came out for the south, and to his sons was allotted the storehouse.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Shuppim and Hosah it came out for the west, at the gate of Shallecheth on the ascending road. Guard corresponded to guard.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the east there were six Levites each day, on the north four each day, on the south four each day, as well as two and two at the storehouse,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the colonnade on the west there were four at the road and two at the colonnade.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers among the Korahites and the sons of Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the Levites, Ahijah had charge of the treasuries of the house of God and the treasuries of the dedicated gifts.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ladan, the sons of the Gershonites belonging to Ladan, the heads of families belonging to Ladan the Gershonite: Jehieli.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehieli, Zetham and his brother Joel, were in charge of the treasuries of the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites:
speaker: Narrator

text: Shebuel son of Gershom, son of Moses, was chief officer in charge of the treasuries.
speaker: Narrator

text: His brothers: from Eliezer were his son Rehabiah, his son Jeshaiah, his son Joram, his son Zichri, and his son Shelomoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: This Shelomoth and his brothers were in charge of all the treasuries of the dedicated gifts that King David, and the heads of families, and the officers of the thousands and the hundreds, and the commanders of the army had dedicated.
speaker: Narrator

text: From spoil won in battles they dedicated gifts for the maintenance of the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also all that Samuel the seer, and Saul son of Kish, and Abner son of Ner, and Joab son of Zeruiah had dedicated—all dedicated gifts were in the care of Shelomoth and his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were appointed to outside duties for Israel, as officers and judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brothers, one thousand seven hundred men of ability, had the oversight of Israel west of the Jordan for all the work of the Lord and for the service of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the Hebronites, Jerijah was chief of the Hebronites. (In the fortieth year of David’s reign search was made of whatever genealogy or family and men of great ability among them were found at Jazer in Gilead.)
speaker: Narrator

text: King David appointed him and his brothers, two thousand seven hundred men of ability, heads of families, to have the oversight of the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of the Manassites for everything pertaining to God and for the affairs of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the list of the people of Israel, the heads of families, the commanders of the thousands and the hundreds, and their officers who served the king in all matters concerning the divisions that came and went, month after month throughout the year, each division numbering twenty-four thousand:
speaker: Narrator

text: Jashobeam son of Zabdiel was in charge of the first division in the first month; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was a descendant of Perez and was chief of all the commanders of the army for the first month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dodai the Ahohite was in charge of the division of the second month; Mikloth was the chief officer of his division. In his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The third commander, for the third month, was Benaiah son of the chief priest Jehoiada; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the Benaiah who was a mighty man of the Thirty and in command of the Thirty; his son Ammizabad was in charge of his division.
speaker: Narrator

text: Asahel brother of Joab was fourth, for the fourth month, and his son Zebadiah after him; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fifth commander, for the fifth month, was Shamhuth, the Izrahite; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sixth, for the sixth month, was Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seventh, for the seventh month, was Helez the Pelonite, of the Ephraimites; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eighth, for the eighth month, was Sibbecai the Hushathite, of the Zerahites; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ninth, for the ninth month, was Abiezer of Anathoth, a Benjaminite; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tenth, for the tenth month, was Maharai of Netophah, of the Zerahites; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleventh, for the eleventh month, was Benaiah of Pirathon, of the Ephraimites; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Twelfth, for the twelfth month, was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the tribes of Israel, for the Reubenites, Eliezer son of Zichri was chief officer; for the Simeonites, Shephatiah son of Maacah;
speaker: Narrator

text: for Levi, Hashabiah son of Kemuel; for Aaron, Zadok;
speaker: Narrator

text: for Judah, Elihu, one of David’s brothers; for Issachar, Omri son of Michael;
speaker: Narrator

text: for Zebulun, Ishmaiah son of Obadiah; for Naphtali, Jerimoth son of Azriel;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the Ephraimites, Hoshea son of Azaziah; for the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joel son of Pedaiah;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo son of Zechariah; for Benjamin, Jaasiel son of Abner;
speaker: Narrator

text: for Dan, Azarel son of Jeroham. These were the leaders of the tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David did not count those below twenty years of age, for the Lord had promised to make Israel as numerous as the stars of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joab son of Zeruiah began to count them but did not finish, yet wrath came upon Israel for this, and the number was not entered into the account of the Annals of King David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the king’s treasuries was Azmaveth son of Adiel. Over the treasuries in the country, in the cities, in the villages and in the towers was Jonathan son of Uzziah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over those who did the work of the field, tilling the soil, was Ezri son of Chelub.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the vineyards was Shimei the Ramathite. Over the produce of the vineyards for the wine cellars was Zabdi the Shiphmite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the olive and sycamore trees in the Shephelah was Baal-hanan the Gederite. Over the stores of oil was Joash.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the herds that pastured in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite. Over the herds in the valleys was Shaphat son of Adlai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the camels was Obil the Ishmaelite. Over the donkeys was Jehdeiah the Meronothite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the flocks was Jaziz the Hagrite. All these were stewards of King David’s property.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jonathan, David’s uncle, was a counselor, being a man of understanding and a scribe; Jehiel son of Hachmoni attended the king’s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahithophel was the king’s counselor, and Hushai the Archite was the king’s friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Ahithophel came Jehoiada son of Benaiah and Abiathar. Joab was commander of the king’s army.
speaker: Narrator

text: David assembled at Jerusalem all the officials of Israel, the officials of the tribes, the officers of the divisions that served the king, the commanders of the thousands, the commanders of the hundreds, the stewards of all the property and cattle of the king, and his sons, together with the palace officials, the mighty warriors, and all the warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King David rose to his feet and said, “Hear me, my brothers and my people. I had planned to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the Lord, for the footstool of our God, and I made preparations for building.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God said to me, ‘You shall not build a house for my name, for you are a warrior and have shed blood.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the Lord God of Israel chose me from all my ancestral house to be king over Israel forever, for he chose Judah as leader, and in the house of Judah my father’s house, and among my father’s sons he took delight in making me king over all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of all my sons, for the Lord has given me many, he has chosen my son Solomon to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the Lord over Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to me, ‘It is your son Solomon who shall build my house and my courts, for I have chosen him to be a son to me, and I will be a father to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will establish his kingdom forever, if he continues resolute in keeping my commandments and my ordinances, as he is today.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore in the sight of all Israel, the assembly of the Lord, and in the hearing of our God, observe and search out all the commandments of the Lord your God, that you may possess this good land and leave it for an inheritance to your children after you forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you, my son Solomon, know the God of your father, and serve him with single mind and willing heart, for the Lord searches every mind and understands every plan and thought. If you seek him, he will be found by you, but if you forsake him, he will abandon you forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed, now, for the Lord has chosen you to build a house as the sanctuary; be strong, and act.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David gave his son Solomon the plan of the vestibule and of its houses, its treasuries, its upper rooms, and its inner chambers, and of the room for the cover,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the plan of all that he had in mind for the courts of the house of the Lord, all the surrounding chambers, the treasuries of the house of God, and the treasuries for dedicated gifts;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the divisions of the priests and of the Levites, and all the work of the service in the house of the Lord; for all the vessels for the service in the house of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: the weight of gold for all golden vessels for each service, the weight of silver vessels for each service,
speaker: Narrator

text: the weight of the golden lampstands and their lamps, the weight of gold for each lampstand and its lamps, the weight of silver for a lampstand and its lamps, according to the use of each in the service,
speaker: Narrator

text: the weight of gold for each table for the rows of bread, the silver for the silver tables,
speaker: Narrator

text: and pure gold for the forks, the basins, and the cups; for the golden bowls and the weight of each; for the silver bowls and the weight of each;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the altar of incense made of refined gold and its weight; also his plan for the golden chariot of the cherubim that spread their wings and covered the ark of the covenant of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All this, in writing at the Lord’s direction, he made clear to me—the plan of all the works.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David said further to his son Solomon, “Be strong and of good courage, and act. Do not be afraid or dismayed, for the Lord God, my God, is with you. He will not fail you or forsake you, until all the work for the service of the house of the Lord is finished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Here are the divisions of the priests and the Levites for all the service of the house of God, and with you in all the work will be every volunteer who has skill for any kind of service; also the officers and all the people will be wholly at your command.”
speaker: Narrator

text: King David said to the whole assembly, “My son Solomon, whom alone God has chosen, is young and inexperienced, and the work is great, for the temple will not be for mortals but for the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I have provided for the house of my God, so far as I was able, the gold for the things of gold, the silver for the things of silver, and the bronze for the things of bronze, the iron for the things of iron, and wood for the things of wood, besides great quantities of onyx and stones for setting, antimony, colored stones, all sorts of precious stones, and marble in abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, in addition to all that I have provided for the holy house, I have a treasure of my own of gold and silver, and because of my devotion to the house of my God I give it to the house of my God:
speaker: Narrator

text: three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, for overlaying the walls of the house,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for all the work to be done by artisans, gold for the things of gold and silver for the things of silver. Who then will offer willingly, consecrating themselves today to the Lord?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the leaders of ancestral houses made their freewill offerings, as did also the leaders of the tribes of Israel, the commanders of the thousands and of the hundreds, and the officers over the king’s work.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave for the service of the house of God five thousand talents and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever had precious stones gave them to the treasury of the house of the Lord, into the care of Jehiel the Gershonite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people rejoiced because these had given willingly, for with single mind they had offered freely to the Lord; King David also rejoiced greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David blessed the Lord in the presence of all the assembly; David said, “Blessed are you, O Lord, the God of our ancestor Israel, forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yours, O Lord, are the greatness, the power, the glory, the victory, and the majesty, for all that is in the heavens and on the earth is yours; yours is the kingdom, O Lord, and you are exalted as head above all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Riches and honor come from you, and you rule over all. In your hand are power and might, and it is in your hand to make great and to give strength to all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, our God, we give thanks to you and praise your glorious name.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to make this freewill offering? For all things come from you, and of your own have we given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are aliens and transients before you, as were all our ancestors; our days on the earth are like a shadow, and there is no hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord our God, all this abundance that we have provided for building you a house for your holy name comes from your hand and is all your own.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know, my God, that you search the heart and take pleasure in uprightness; in the uprightness of my heart I have freely offered all these things, and now I have seen your people who are present here offering freely and joyously to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our ancestors, keep forever such purposes and thoughts in the hearts of your people, and direct their hearts toward you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Grant to my son Solomon that with single mind he may keep your commandments, your decrees, and your statutes, performing all of them, and that he may build the temple for which I have made provision.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said to the whole assembly, “Bless the Lord your God.” And all the assembly blessed the Lord, the God of their ancestors, and bowed their heads and prostrated themselves before the Lord and the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next day they offered sacrifices and burnt offerings to the Lord, a thousand bulls, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, with their libations, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and they ate and drank before the Lord on that day with great joy.
They made David’s son Solomon king a second time; they anointed him as the Lord’s prince and Zadok as priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon sat on the throne of the Lord, succeeding his father David as king; he prospered, and all Israel obeyed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the leaders and the mighty warriors and also all the sons of King David pledged their allegiance to King Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord highly exalted Solomon in the sight of all Israel and bestowed upon him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus David son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The period that he reigned over Israel was forty years; he reigned seven years in Hebron, and thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: He died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honor, and his son Solomon succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the acts of King David, from first to last, are written in the records of the seer Samuel, and in the records of the prophet Nathan, and in the records of the seer Gad,
speaker: Narrator

text: with accounts of all his rule and his might and of the events that befell him and Israel and all the kingdoms of the earth.
speaker: Narrator
